etymologies: Middle English (originally in the plural): from Old Norse vængir, plural of vængr

definitions: (in a bird) a modified forelimb that bears large feathers and is used for flying.
shortDefinitions: (in bird) modified forelimb used for flying

definitions: (in a bat or pterosaur) a modified forelimb with skin stretched between or behind the fingers.
shortDefinitions: (in bat or pterosaur) modified forelimb

definitions: (in most insects) each of two or four flat extensions of the thoracic cuticle, either transparent or covered in scales.
shortDefinitions: extension of thoracic cuticle

definitions: the meat on the wing bone of a bird used as food.
shortDefinitions: wing of bird as food

definitions: used with reference to ease and swiftness of movement
shortDefinitions: used of ease and swiftness of movement

definitions: a rigid horizontal structure that projects from both sides of an aircraft and supports it in the air.
shortDefinitions: rigid horizontal structure that projects from both sides of aircraft

definitions: a pilot's certificate of ability to fly a plane, indicated by a badge representing a pair of wings

examples.text: Michael earned his wings as a commercial pilot

shortDefinitions: pilot's certificate of ability to fly plane

definitions: a raised part of the body of a car or other vehicle above the wheel.
shortDefinitions: raised part of body of car or other vehicle above wheel

definitions: a part of a large building, especially one that projects from the main part

examples.text: the maternity wing at South Cleveland Hospital

shortDefinitions: part of large building

definitions: a group within a political party or other organization that holds particular views or has a particular function

examples.text: Sinn Fein, the political wing of the IRA

shortDefinitions: group within political party or other organization having particular views

definitions: the sides of a theater stage out of view of the audience.
shortDefinitions: sides of theatre stage out of view of audience

definitions: (in soccer, rugby, and other games) the part of the field close to the sidelines.
shortDefinitions: (in soccer, rugby, and hockey) part of field close to sidelines

definitions: (in soccer, ice hockey, and other games) an attacking player who plays mostly forward close to one side of the field or rink.
shortDefinitions: attacking player positioned near to one of sidelines

definitions: a lateral part or projection of an organ or structure.
shortDefinitions: lateral part or projection of organ or structure

definitions: a thin membranous appendage of a fruit or seed that is dispersed by the wind.
shortDefinitions: thin membranous appendage of fruit or seed that is dispersed by wind

definitions: an air force unit of several squadrons or groups.
shortDefinitions: air force unit of several squadrons or groups

definitions: the right or left flank of the main body of a battle formation.
shortDefinitions: right or left flank of battle formation

phrases.text: on a wing and a prayer

definitions: travel on wings or by aircraft; fly

examples.text: a bird came winging around the corner

notes.text: no object, with adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: travel on wings or by aircraft

definitions: move, travel, or be sent quickly, as if flying

examples.text: the prize will be winging its way to you soon

shortDefinitions: move, travel, or be sent quickly, as if flying

definitions: send or convey (something) quickly, as if by air

examples.text: just jot down the title on a postcard and wing it to us

notes.text: with object and adverbial of direction

shortDefinitions: send or convey something quickly, as if by air

definitions: enable (someone or something) to fly or move rapidly

examples.text: the convent was at some distance, but fear would wing her steps

shortDefinitions: enable person or thing to fly or move rapidly

definitions: shoot (a bird) in the wing, so as to prevent flight without causing death

examples.text: one bird was winged for every bird killed

shortDefinitions: shoot bird in wing, so as to prevent flight without causing death

definitions: wound (someone) superficially, especially in the arm or shoulder.
shortDefinitions: wound someone superficially

definitions: speak or act without preparation; improvise
etymologies: from theatrical slang, originally meaning ‘to play a role without properly knowing the text’ (either by relying on a prompter in the wings or by studying the part in the wings between scenes)

examples.text: a little boning up puts you ahead of the job seekers who try to wing it

shortDefinitions: speak or act without preparation

phrases.text: on a wing and a prayer
